item.title: Python/Reticulate
item.description: hw = "hello world" hw[0:11] ## 'hello world' library(reticulate) hi<-"Hello" hi="world" print(r.hi,hi) ## Hello world cat(c(hi,py$hi)) ## Hello world

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: ## paste this chunk into the ```{r setup} chunk at the top of ## your project 1 .Rmd file knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, eval = TRUE, fig.align = "center", warning = F, message = F, tidy = TRUE, tidy.opts = list(width.cutoff = 60), R.options = list(max.print = 100)) Data Wrangling and Data Exploration 0. Introduction Write a narrative introductory paragraph or two describing the datasets you have chosen, the variables they contain, how they were acquired, and why they are interesting to you.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: library(ggplot2) library(lmtest) library(plotROC) library(glmnet) library(sandwich) library(dplyr) library(tidyverse) 0. (5 pts) Introduce your dataset and each of your variables (or just your main variables if you have lots) in a paragraph. What are they measuring? How many observations? library("readxl") df <- read_excel("sleepdata.xlsx") head(df) ## # A tibble: 6 x 8 ## Start End `Sleep quality … minutes `Time in Bed (hrs)` `>7 hours` ## <dttm> <dttm> <dbl> <dbl> <dttm> <lgl> ## 1 2021-05-03 22:38:00 2021-05-04 06:16:00 51 458 1899-12-31 07:38:00 TRUE ## 2 2021-05-02 22:29:00 2021-05-03 06:35:00 57 486 1899-12-31 08:06:00 TRUE ## 3 2021-05-01 23:19:00 2021-05-02 06:25:00 34 426 1899-12-31 07:06:00 TRUE ## 4 2021-04-30 22:17:00 2021-05-01 06:27:00 73 490 1899-12-31 08:10:00 TRUE ## 5 2021-04-29 20:32:00 2021-04-30 06:45:00 51 613 1899-12-31 10:13:00 TRUE ## 6 2021-04-28 21:26:00 2021-04-29 07:16:00 63 590 1899-12-31 09:50:00 TRUE ## # … with 2 more variables: `Heart Rate` <dbl>, `Activity (steps)` <dbl> names(df) <- c("startTime", "endTime", "quality", "minutes", "hours","adequate","heartRate", "steps") class_diag<-function(probs,truth){ tab<-table(factor(probs>.
